name: D.A. Pennebaker
biography:
Born 1926

After attending Yale and M.I.T., and spending time in the Navy, Pennebaker worked a variety of jobs, including stints as a painter and an advertising copywriter.

His first film,'Daybreak Express' was made in 1953. In 1959 he joined Richard Leacock, the Mayles Brother and others at Drew Associates, who, in association with Time Inc aimed to further the use of film in journalism. Drew Associates developed the first fully portable 16mm film system, allowing the development of the 'cinema verite' documentary style, whereby the filmmakers adopted an observational, fly-on-the-wall approach to their subject matter, in opposition to the use of planned interviews and 'voice of God' narration.

Pennebaker's extensive and influential body of work has focused largely on political and musical subjects, including the landmark 'Primary' (1960), which followed Kennedy in the Winsconsin Presidential Primary and 'Don't Look Back' (1965), a behind the scenes portrait of Bob Dylan on tour in England. In recent years he has documented the Clinton Presidential campaign in 'The War Room' (1992) and a concert featuring artists who contributed to the soundtrack of the Coen Brothers film 'O Brother Where Art Thou' in
'Down From The Mountain' (2002)

Since the mid-seventies he has been joined by Chris Hegedus as co-director on many projects.

1998, Bessie-A Portrait of Bessie Schonberg, A portrait of a beloved choreographer teacher.

1993, The War Room, Clinton's 1992 campaign with George Stephanopoulos and James Carville.
1992, Branford Marsalis - The Music Tells You, On tour with Branford Marsalis.
1991, Comin' Home, A musical portrait of Janis Joplin and Big Brother and the Holding Company.
1991, Little Richard, The entire performance at the 1969 Toronto Rock and Roll Revival Concert.
1990, Jerry Lee Lewis, The ultimate musical portrait of Jerry Lee Lewis.
1989, Depeche Mode 101, On the road with the synthi/pop band and a bus of fans.
1988, Sweet Toronto, John Lennon and Yoko Ono at the Toronto Rock and Roll Revival in 1967.
1987, Suzanne Vega, A musical portrait of the singer/songwriter.
1986, Shake - Otis at Monterey, Otis Redding's complete 1967 performance at Monterey Pop.
1985, Jimi Plays Monterey, Jimi Hendrix's complete triumphant debut at the Montery Pop Festival.
1983, Dance Black America, Celebration of the roots of black dance with Alvin Ailey and others.
1983, Krapp's Last Tape, Jack MaCowran in Alan Schneider's production of the Beckett play.
1981, DeLorean, John DeLorean produces his steel gull-wing door dream car in Northern Ireland.
1981, Rockaby, Billie Whitelaw in Alan Schneider's production of a Samuel Beckett play.
1980, Elliot Carter at Buffalo, A unique portrait of the renowned composer.
1979, Town Bloody Hall, Norman Mailer and Germaine Greer's legendary 1971 Women's Lib debate.
1978, The Energy War, A series following the fight in Senate over President Carter's natural gas bill.
1973, Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders from Mars, Bowie's last performance as Ziggy Stardust.
1972, Keep On Rockin, Chuck Berry, Little Richard, Jerry Lee-Lewis and Bo Diddley, Toronto, 1969.
1971, One PM, Jean Luc Godard's never completed One American Movie (1AM).
1970, Alice Cooper, Alice Cooper at the 1969 Toronto Rock and Roll Revival concert.
1970, Company: Original Cast Album, Elaine Stritch in the cast recording of Sondheim's musical.
1970, Queen of Apollo, An exclusive New Orleans Mardi Gras Ball by Richard Leacock.
1968, Chiefs, 1968 Police Chief Convention.
1968, Hickory Hill, George Plimpton's annual spring pet show at Robert F. Kennedy's estate.
1968, Rainforest, Merce Cunningham Ballet. Music by John Cage. Set Design by Andy Warhol.
1968, Two American Audiences, Jean-Luc Godard on filmmaking and politics.
1968, Un Film Comme Les Autres, A rare film by Jean-Luc Godard about the 1968 student uprising in France.
1967, Monterey Pop, The festival with Hendrix, Janis Joplin, Ravi Shankar, The Mamas and the Papas, & more.
1966, Dont Look Back, Pennebaker's famous portrait of Bob Dylan.
1965, A Stravinsky Portrait, The composer discusses creativity and his work by Richard Leacock.
1964, Campaign Manager, On the trail with Republican campaign manager John Grenier.
1964, Jingle Bells, Robert Kennedy & Sammy Davis Jr. celebrate Christmas with NYC school children
1964, Lambert & Co, Dave Lambert (of Lambert, Hendricks, and Ross) auditions for RCA.
1964, You're Nobody Till Somebody Loves You, Timothy Leary's wedding day.
1963, Happy Mother's Day, How the birth of the Fischer quintuplets affected their hometown.
1960, Anatomy of Cindy Fink, Portrait of a young girl's first jazz dance audition by Richard Leacock.
1960, Breaking It Up at the Museum, Artist Jean Tinguely and his self-destructing machine.
1959, Opening in Moscow, Impressions of Moscow under the Krushchev regime.
1954, Baby, Pennebaker's first cinema verite film. A portrait of his daughter at the Central Park zoo.
1953, Daybreak Express, Pennebaker's first movie, a subway ride set to the Duke Ellington song.
